subject: linear_algebra
title: Gaussian Elimination: Solving Systems of Linear Equations
contentHtml: Gaussian elimination is a powerful technique to solve systems of linear equations.

problem.solutionHtml:
To solve this system, we'll use Gaussian elimination.

  1. We'll add the second equation multiplied by 2 to the first equation:

    2. \( 4x + 6y = 8 \)

  2. This eliminates y from the first equation. Now we can solve for x:

    3. \( x = 1 \)

  3. We'll then substitute this value back into one of the original equations to find y:

    4. \( y = 1 \)

steps.description: Add the second equation multiplied by (-1/3) to the first equation
steps.explanation: This eliminates x from the first equation

steps.description: Add the resulting equation to the second equation
steps.explanation: This eliminates y from the second equation

steps.description: Solve for x and then substitute back into one of the original equations to find y
steps.explanation: Now we can solve for both variables

intuition: Gaussian elimination is a powerful technique to solve systems of linear equations by transforming the matrix into row echelon form.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Gaussian Elimination: Solving Systems of Linear Equations
contentHtml: In this worked example, we'll apply Gaussian elimination to solve a system of linear equations.

problem.statementHtml:
Solve the system of linear equations:

  • 2x + 3y - z = 5
  • x - 2y + 3z = -3
  • 4x + y + 2z = 7
hints: Start by performing row operations to get the system in row echelon form
problem.solutionHtml: To solve this system, we'll use Gaussian elimination.
problem.answerShort: The solution is x = 1, y = 2, z = 3

steps.description: Perform row operations to get the system in row echelon form.
steps.explanation: We want to eliminate variables and make the system easier to solve.

steps.description: Add -2 times row 1 to row 2 to eliminate x.
steps.explanation: This eliminates x from the second equation.

steps.description: Add -4 times row 1 to row 3 to eliminate x.
steps.explanation: This eliminates x from the third equation.

steps.description: Add -3 times row 2 to row 1 to eliminate y.
steps.explanation: This eliminates y from the first equation.

steps.description: Add row 3 to row 1 to eliminate z.
steps.explanation: This eliminates z from the first equation.

workedExample.finalAnswer: The solution is x = 1, y = 2, z = 3

intuition: Gaussian elimination helps us solve systems of linear equations by performing row operations to get the system in row echelon form.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Gaussian Elimination: Solving Systems of Linear Equations
contentHtml: Gaussian elimination is a popular method for solving systems of linear equations.
name: Linear System" },
statementHtml:
Solve the system:

\[ \begin{align*} x + 2y - z &= 1 \\ 3x - y + 2z &= 0 \\ 4x + 3y + z &= 2 \end{align*}\]",
solutionHtml: We'll use Gaussian elimination to solve the system.
problemHtml:
Solve the system:

\[ \begin{align*} x + 2y - z &= 1 \\ 3x - y + 2z &= 0 \\ 4x + 3y + z &= 2 \end{align*}\]",
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Rearrange the equations to eliminate variables", "mathHtml": "\(R_1 - 2R_2\)", "explanation": "This eliminates y from the first equation"}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Use row operations to eliminate x from the second equation", "mathHtml": "\(R_2 - \frac{3}{4} R_1\)", "explanation": "This eliminates x from the second equation"}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Eliminate z from the third equation using the first two equations", "mathHtml": "\(R_3 - 4R_1 + 3R_2\)", "explanation": "This eliminates z from the third equation"} ],
intuition: Gaussian elimination is a systematic way to eliminate variables and solve systems of linear equations.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Gaussian Elimination: Solving Systems of Linear Equations
contentHtml: Gaussian elimination is a popular method for solving systems of linear equations.
name: Linear System" },
solutionHtml: We'll use Gaussian elimination to solve this system.
steps: [ {"stepNumber": 1, "description": "Write the augmented matrix", "mathHtml": "\[\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ 2 & -2 \end{bmatrix} | \begin{bmatrix} 5 \\ -3 \end{bmatrix}\]"}, {"stepNumber": 2, "description": "Eliminate the second row's first element", "mathHtml": "\[\begin{bmatrix} 3 & 1 \\ 0 & -\frac{1}{2} \end{bmatrix} | \begin{bmatrix} 5 \\ -\frac{7}{2} \end{bmatrix}\]"}, {"stepNumber": 3, "description": "Back-substitute to find the solution", "mathHtml": "\[\mathbf{x} = [1, 1]\]"}, {"stepNumber": 4, "description": "Verify the solution", "mathHtml": ""} ],
intuition: Gaussian elimination works by transforming the augmented matrix into row echelon form and then back-substituting to find the solution.
visualDescription: A helpful diagram could show the step-by-step process of Gaussian elimination.

subject: linear_algebra
title: Gaussian Elimination: Solving Systems of Linear Equations
contentHtml: Gaussian elimination is a popular method for solving systems of linear equations.
name: Linear System" },
solutionHtml:
To solve this system using Gaussian elimination, we'll first write it in augmented matrix form:

\\[\\begin{bmatrix} 2 & 1 & | & 5 \\\ 1 & -3 & | & -1 \\end{bmatrix}\\]

",

steps.explanation: This is the standard form for Gaussian elimination.
We'll eliminate y by adding -4 times the second equation to the first.
Now we'll eliminate x by adding -2 times the second equation to the first.
Now we can find the values of x and y by back substituting.
We can check our solution by plugging it back into the original equations.

intuition: Gaussian elimination is a powerful tool for solving systems of linear equations. By repeatedly eliminating variables and back substituting, we can find the solution.
visualDescription: A diagram showing the steps of Gaussian elimination
realWorldApplications: Solving problems in computer vision, robotics
